intro: Cuminum brevisetum, commonly known as the short-setose cumin, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, often found in dry, rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
